Parent-Child.description: A parent-child relationship represents a hierarchical association where one component (the parent) acts as the container, host, manager, or aggregator for another component (the child). The source component is always the parent, and the target component is always the child.
Parent-Child.keyCharacteristics:
Parent Component: Acts as the container, host, manager, or aggregator.
Child Component: Is contained, hosted, managed, or aggregated by the parent.
Parent-Child.identificationCriteria:
Containment or Hosting: Look for evidence that one component contains, hosts, manages, or aggregates another component.
Hierarchical Structure: Verify the hierarchical nature of the relationship.

Dependency.description: A dependency relationship exists when one component (the dependent) relies on the functionality or data of another component (the provider). The source component is always the dependent, and the target component is always the provider.
Dependency.keyCharacteristics:
Dependent Component: Relies on the functionality or data of another component.
Provider Component: Provides the functionality or data required by the dependent.
Dependency.identificationCriteria:
Functionality or Data Dependency: Look for evidence that one component relies on the functionality or data of another component.
Operational Dependency: Verify that the dependent component requires the provider component to function properly.
